title: CIA and FBI communications, intererogations and subsequent communications with Hedwig Potthast Heinrich Himmlers secratery (Central Intelligence Agency)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hedwig Potthast was Heinrich Himmlers secretary and girlfriend, she bore him 2 children. She was in a position to know a lot about him and the SS. After the was the OSS/CIA took care of her and her children for the remainder of her life, she was placed in witness protection, (eventually a new name) she was interrogated and interviewed many times. I would like the full records of all the information she gave the OSS/CIA/FBI after the war and for the remainder.
Also why was she protected and cared for by the CIA, what assets did she provide the Agency.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tino Von Struckmann

title: Allan Dulles communications with the SS and SS General Hans Kammler 1944 - 1947

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Allan Dulles communications with the SS and SS General Hans Kammler 1944 - 1947
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

As lead for the  OSS and later the CIA Allan Dulles was in communication with various SS intelligence officers during the second world war, and after the war continued working with some of them. 
I am looking for all communications Allan Dulles and his officers had with SS General Hans Kammler or Kammlers men in Germany during the second world war and after. (you can exclude SS General Wolf regarding the surrender of Italy communications) These communications regards special projects, bank accounts, valuables, and the Generals Surrender among other things. 
Following the wars end, the communications with the SS General and his closest continued for years are also sought.
I would like Allan Dulles and his officers papers, notes, reports, interrogation reports on Hans Kammler about him and his duties. including the post war follow up and subsequent reports, OSS to CIA handover and final status of General Hans Kammler (do make notes that in some previous reports the Generals name is mis-spelled causing slight variations)

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tino Von Struckmann

title: Melvin Jeter Arrest Report

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Melvin Jeter Arrest Report
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dear MuckRock Team,

I am requesting your assistance in submitting a Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to the Chesterfield County Police Department in Virginia. I am not a resident of the Commonwealth of Virginia, and my own request for records was denied on that basis. I understand that MuckRock may be able to assist by filing the request through a Virginia resident proxy.

I am seeking public records related to the arrest of Melvin Jeter, who was taken into custody on April 7, 2025, in Chesterfield County, Virginia. According to publicly available information, Mr. Jeter was arrested for petit larceny and making a terrorist threat.

Specifically, I am requesting:

    The arrest report

    The incident or offense report

    Booking and charge information

    Mugshot (if available)

    Any court referral or charging documentation related to this arrest

If the request is too broad or requires narrowing, I am happy to provide additional information. I would prefer to receive the records electronically, if possible. Please also inform me if there are any fees associated with filing or processing this request.

Thank you very much for your assistance in promoting access to public information. I look forward to your response.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Adam Padro Castro.

title: DPS Policies and Guidance on PTSA, Volunteers, and Third-Party Program Oversight

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: DPS Policies and Guidance on PTSA, Volunteers, and Third-Party Program Oversight
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request access to the following public records under the Colorado Open Records Act (CORA), § 24-72-201 et seq., C.R.S., covering the period from August 1, 2024, through the date this request is received. These records relate to internal Denver Public Schools (DPS) documentation, policy, training, and oversight practices concerning volunteer conduct, PTA/PTSA programs, and third-party liability or risk management on DPS campuses.

This request includes relevant historical documentation necessary to evaluate DPS’s policies and oversight practices, including any prior incidents or district-level assessments that inform current procedures.

Requested Records: 
All internal DPS records, materials, and documentation—including but not limited to policies, training materials, legal guidance, reference documents, written procedures, risk memos, internal reviews, or official evaluations that reference or relate to:

- Oversight, accountability, and risk management for PTA/PTSA-run activities or programs operating on DPS campuses
- Expectations for volunteer conduct, enforcement mechanisms, and any “Adult Code of Conduct” policies, especially as applied to third-party or PTA-affiliated adults
- DPS responsibility for safety, supervision, or liability in relation to PTA/PTSA programs or other non-DPS activities involving students, parents, or volunteers
- Guidance or directives provided to school leaders (including principals) for managing third-party, PTA-run, or volunteer-led programs
- Any discussion or interpretation of DPS Board Policy KFA and its applicability to non-DPS programs (including PTSA) operating on DPS campuses
- Internal guidance or materials related to responding to complaints, defamation, or reputational harm involving volunteers or community members
- DPS’s stated or interpreted responsibility for managing adult behavior, safety, and legal exposure on school campuses in connection with non-employee adults

For the period August 1, 2022 to present: Any documentation, communications, or internal evaluations related to PTA/PTSA-run programs at DPS schools that involved complaints, safety concerns, policy violations, or adult misconduct—particularly where DPS personnel played a role in oversight, response, complaint resolution, or risk assessment

If applicable, include any materials shared with or developed by:
- School principals or other administrative staff (including Centennial Principal Volkert)
- DPS Operational Services staff (including Director Scott Wolf)
- DPS Human Resources personnel
- Legal or Risk Management personnel
- School PTAs or PTSAs
- Family and Community Engagement (FACE) Office
- Volunteer Services or other departments responsible for volunteer programs

This request excludes general internal communications (such as emails, chats, or text messages), which are covered under a separate CORA request submitted concurrently (“DPS Internal Records on PTSA Incidents – Centennial Oct 2024 & Mar 2025”). However, if any such communications are attached to or embedded within formal documentation—such as policies, training materials, legal reviews, or procedural guidance—they should be included in the responsive records for this request.

If any portion of this request yields no responsive records, I respectfully request that you state that explicitly. If any documents are withheld, please provide the specific legal basis for denial (including citation to the relevant CORA exemption) and a general description of the material being withheld as required under § 24-72-204(3)(a), C.R.S.

Please notify me if clarification or narrowing would expedite fulfillment.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Patrick Quigley

- DPS’s stated or interpreted responsibility for managing adult behavior, safety, and legal exposure on school campuses in connection with non-employee adults

For the period August 1, 2022 to present: Any documentation, communications, or internal evaluations related to PTA/PTSA-run programs at DPS schools that involved complaints, safety concerns, policy violations, or adult misconduct—particularly where DPS personnel played a role in oversight, response, complaint resolution, or risk assessment

If applicable, include any materials shared with or developed by:
- School principals or other administrative staff (including Centennial Principal Volkert)
- DPS Operational Services staff (including Director Scott Wolf)
- DPS Human Resources personnel
- Legal or Risk Management personnel
- School PTAs or PTSAs
- Family and Community Engagement (FACE) Office
- Volunteer Services or other departments responsible for volunteer programs

This request excludes general internal communications (such as emails, chats, or text messages), which are covered under a separate CORA request submitted concurrently (“DPS Internal Records on PTSA Incidents – Centennial Oct 2024 & Mar 2025”). However, if any such communications are attached to or embedded within formal documentation—such as policies, training materials, legal reviews, or procedural guidance—they should be included in the responsive records for this request.

If any portion of this request yields no responsive records, I respectfully request that you state that explicitly. If any documents are withheld, please provide the specific legal basis for denial (including citation to the relevant CORA exemption) and a general description of the material being withheld as required under § 24-72-204(3)(a), C.R.S.

Please notify me if clarification or narrowing would expedite fulfillment.

Sincerely,

Patrick Quigley

The Colorado Open Records Act requires a response within three business days (excludes holidays, closures and weekends). The three‐day timeline begins on the first business day following the receipt of the request.  Multiple requests in one email will be treated as one request for reimbursement purposes.  The district may also treat multiple requests concerning the same subject matter as one request.  The process is as follows: 
 
  * The CORA Officer will review your request and work with staff to determine: 
 
  * If the district is the custodian of the requested documents;

Please note: The Colorado Open Records Act only makes available public records that already exist. It does not require the creation of new records to respond to a request. The Colorado Open Records Act allows for the following reimbursement for reasonable costs associated with completing a request:

title: Public Records Request — Incident Involving Jackie Hunt and Detention Officers Charged (March–April 2025)

communications.subject: North Carolina Public Records Law Request: Public Records Request — Incident Involving Jackie Hunt and Detention Officers Charged (March–April 2025)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the North Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

public records related to the March 25, 2025 arrest of a man who falsely identified himself as Jackie Hunt, and the subsequent charges filed against three Robeson County Detention Center officers, including:

Jackie Hunt, 40, of Fairmont

Warren Phillips, 50, of Lumberton

Tina Jones, 51, of Pembroke

According to publicly released information, the arrested man falsely provided his brother's name and was knowingly processed under the false identity by the above officers, resulting in their being charged with felony conspiracy to commit identity theft, aiding and abetting, and obstruction of justice. The arrest reportedly stemmed from a traffic stop related to drug possession, driving while license revoked, and carrying a concealed weapon.

I am requesting access to and copies of the following:

Arrest and incident reports for both the March 25 and April 16 arrests of the individual posing as Jackie Hunt.

Booking, intake, and release records for the individual under both his real name and the alias.

Internal reports, incident summaries, or investigation findings regarding the conduct of the detention officers.

Charging documents and arrest affidavits for Jackie Hunt, Warren Phillips, and Tina Jones.

Surveillance footage or jail records related to the intake and release of the falsely identified individual.

Copies of any press releases issued by the Robeson County Sheriff’s Office on or around April 20, 2025, regarding this case.

Any available written statements or disciplinary actions related to this incident.

If any records are exempt from disclosure under North Carolina law, please provide a written explanation citing the specific exemption that applies. I prefer to receive the records in electronic format via email, if possible. Please notify me in advance if the cost to fulfill this request will exceed $25.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I appreciate your assistance and look forward to your response. Please contact me at the information above if you need clarification regarding this request.

Sincerely,
Roseland Goodman

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Roseland Goodman

title: Obama Presidential Library: Russia Insider Documents

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Obama Presidential Library: Russia Insider Documents
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of all emails, documents, and memos that reference, mention or cite news coverage from the Russia Insider website (https://russia-insider.com/) exchanged between September 1st, 2014 and January 20th, 2017, sent and received by President Barack Obama; Vice President Joe Biden; Chief of Staff Dennis McDonough; National Security Advisor Susan Rice; NSA Deputies Anthony Blinken and Avril Haines; Press Secretary Josh Earnest and advisors Daniel Pfeiffer, Brian Deese and Shailagh Murray, and Vice President Chief of Staff Steve Ricchetti. 

Of particular interest would be if any articles from https://russia-insider.com were ever cited or shared as serious news coverage between 2014 and 2017. The editor of Russia Insider, Charles Bausman, mysteriously fled the United States following the January 6th, 2021 insurrection. Russia Insider was an English language news outlet that sought to influence perceptions of Putin's regime in the English language media following the seizure of the Crimea.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

title: DPS Internal Records on PTSA Incidents – Centennial (Oct 2024 & Mar 2025)

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: DPS Internal Records on PTSA Incidents – Centennial (Oct 2024 & Mar 2025)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request access to the following public records under the Colorado Open Records Act (CORA), § 24-72-201 et seq., C.R.S., covering the period from October 1, 2024, through the date this request is received. These records concern internal communications within Denver Public Schools (DPS) related to two key incidents at Centennial School for Expeditionary Learning involving the Centennial PTSA and myself (Patrick Quigley):

- An October 23, 2024 incident in which PTSA Committee Co-Chair Michelle Frankel yelled and used profanity toward me, a parent volunteer, on school grounds and in front of students.
- A set of claims made on March 6, 2025, by PTSA Treasurer Eric Lyche, alleging that I violated policy, removed a student from the PTSA Clubs Program, and caused emotional distress to a parent.

For the purposes of this request, “communications” includes, but is not limited to: emails, text messages, meeting notes or summaries, records of phone or in-person conversations, chat messages (including Slack or Microsoft Teams), calendar invites, agendas, and any written or recorded documentation—including internal drafts or materials created by DPS personnel for internal use.

Requested Records:

Please produce all communications and records exchanged between or among the following DPS individuals or departments:

- Scott Wolf, Director of Operational Services
- Emily Volkert, Principal at Centennial
- DPS Human Resources, including Alui Kouassi
- DPS Legal or Risk Management personnel
- DPS Communications personnel
- Regional or instructional superintendents
- Family and Community Engagement (FACE)
- Volunteer Services (or department responsible for volunteer management / support)

...that reference or relate to:

- The October 2024 or March 2025 incidents
- Any use or discussion of my name in connection with those incidents, my volunteer role, or related complaints
- Internal guidance, recommendations, or direction—including from Mr. Wolf to Principal Volkert—regarding how to manage, respond to, or characterize either incident or any related communications involving the PTSA or me
- Internal evaluations or concerns regarding my volunteer role, including reputational risk, conflict management, or parent complaints
- Discussions or evaluations of DPS Board Policy KFA and its applicability to either incident
- Any internal discussion or evaluation of assumed risk, liability, or legal exposure for volunteers participating in programs on DPS campuses, including whether volunteers are considered covered, protected, or personally liable under DPS policy or practice
- Oversight of or internal evaluations related to the PTSA Clubs Program, including PTSA conduct, safety practices, volunteer management, policy compliance, or DPS’s responsibility for incidents involving PTSA volunteers
- Responses to my complaints or requests for retraction, including any internal assessment of reputational risk or incident handling

Please exclude records entirely unrelated to the individuals, incidents, or volunteer role described above (e.g., general personnel matters or unrelated school operations).

If any portion of this request yields no responsive records, I request confirmation of that outcome. If any records are withheld or redacted, please cite the specific legal exemption under § 24-72-204(3)(a), C.R.S., and provide a general description of the withheld material.

If clarification or narrowing would expedite fulfillment, please notify me at your earliest convenience.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Patrick Quigley

title: Centennial PTSA-DPS Communications: Oct 2024 and Mar 2025 Incidents

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Centennial PTSA-DPS Communications: Oct 2024 and Mar 2025 Incidents
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request records under the Colorado Open Records Act (CORA), § 24-72-201 et seq., C.R.S., from October 1, 2024, through the date this request is received. The records relate to interactions between Denver Public Schools (DPS), staff at Centennial School for Expeditionary Learning, the Centennial PTSA, and myself (Patrick Quigley), concerning two key incidents:

1) An October 23, 2024 incident involving PTSA Committee Co-Chair Michelle Frankel yelling and using profanity toward me, a parent volunteer, on school grounds and in front of students.
2) A set of claims made on March 6, 2025, by PTSA Treasurer Eric Lyche, alleging that I violated policy, removed a student from the PTSA Clubs Program, and caused emotional distress to a parent.

For purposes of this request, “communications” includes, but is not limited to: emails, text messages, voicemail transcripts or summaries, meeting notes, agendas, phone logs or call summaries, calendar invites, chat logs (including Slack, Microsoft Teams, or similar platforms), internal drafts, or any other written or recorded materials that document verbal, written, or digital exchanges.

Please include all communication regardless of whether the records originated on personal or non-DPS accounts. This includes, for example, emails sent to or from centennialclubspta@gmail.com or similar accounts used for PTSA-related business. Please also include any communication forwarded or CC’d from PTSA members to DPS personnel.

Requested Records:

1. Communications between Centennial Principal Emily Volkert and any member of the Centennial PTSA (including but not limited to Michelle Frankel, Kelli Goodwin, and Eric Lyche) that reference or relate to:

- The October or March incidents
- Volunteer conduct, student safety, or policy enforcement related to the PTSA Clubs Program

Your request has been received and is being processed. Your request was received in this office on 5/22/2025 and given the reference number R000522-052225 for tracking purposes. 
Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request records under the Colorado Open Records Act (CORA), § 24-72-201 et seq., C.R.S., from October 1, 2024, through the date this request is received. The records relate to interactions between Denver Public Schools (DPS), staff at Centennial School for Expeditionary Learning, the Centennial PTSA, and myself (Patrick Quigley), concerning two key incidents:

1) An October 23, 2024 incident involving PTSA Committee Co-Chair Michelle Frankel yelling and using profanity toward me, a parent volunteer, on school grounds and in front of students.
2) A set of claims made on March 6, 2025, by PTSA Treasurer Eric Lyche, alleging that I violated policy, removed a student from the PTSA Clubs Program, and caused emotional distress to a parent.

For purposes of this request, “communications” includes, but is not limited to: emails, text messages, voicemail transcripts or summaries, meeting notes, agendas, phone logs or call summaries, calendar invites, chat logs (including Slack, Microsoft Teams, or similar platforms), internal drafts, or any other written or recorded materials that document verbal, written, or digital exchanges.

Please include all communication regardless of whether the records originated on personal or non-DPS accounts. This includes, for example, emails sent to or from centennialclubspta@gmail.com or similar accounts used for PTSA-related business. Please also include any communication forwarded or CC’d from PTSA members to DPS personnel.

Requested Records:

1. Communications between Centennial Principal Emily Volkert and any member of the Centennial PTSA (including but not limited to Michelle Frankel, Kelli Goodwin, and Eric Lyche) that reference or relate to:

- The October or March incidents
- Volunteer conduct, student safety, or policy enforcement related to the PTSA Clubs Program
- Discussion of any Code of Conduct or volunteer expectations considered for the PTSA Clubs program
- Any discussion of myself, my concerns about PTSA Clubs, or my volunteer status
- Any instructions or discussions regarding how to respond to communications from me
- Any discussion of parent concerns, student readiness, or decisions about removing or excluding students from Clubs

2. Communications between DPS Director of Operational Services Scott Wolf and any Centennial PTSA member, including any calendar invites or summaries of in-person meetings, that reference or relate to:

- The October or March incidents
- Fact-finding or clarification efforts conducted or requested by Mr. Wolf for either incident
- Narratives or claims made by PTSA members about either incident or its aftermath
- Any direction or talking points from Mr. Wolf on how to respond to or manage the situation
- Discussions of whether the PTSA would issue a retraction, correction, or apology
- Safety, conduct, or oversight procedures for volunteers or PTA activities/programs

3. Communications between Centennial staff (Ms. Robyn Thompson and Ms. Monica Osborn) and any Centennial PTSA member related to:

- Student readiness, behavior, accommodations, or eligibility for the Clubs Program

4. Communications between DPS Human Resources (including Alui Kouassi) and any of the following: Principal Volkert, Scott Wolf, Centennial PTSA members, or other DPS staff, related to:

- Either the October or March incidents
- Oversight of or accountability for the PTSA or its volunteers
- Volunteer conduct, complaint handling, or policy enforcement
- Whether DPS Board Policy KFA or other policies applied to either incident
- The reported HR “typo” or failure to contact the Centennial PTSA
- Any efforts to obtain or verify Centennial PTSA contact info

If any portion of this request yields no responsive records, I ask that you confirm that explicitly. If any records are withheld, please cite the specific legal exemption and provide a general description as required under § 24-72-204(3)(a), C.R.S.

If clarification or narrowing would expedite fulfillment, please notify me.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Patrick Quigley

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fdenver-public-schools-5864%252Fcentennial-ptsa-dps-communications-oct-2024-and-mar-2025-incidents-186883%252F%253Femail%253Dcora%252540dpsk12.org&url_auth_token=AABOPm4MTqHlrCgJ-bwXFFls9Es%3A1uI19O%3ASt1-399BJHrspf2LeLLDtrPPY953dZX1wKQOEYbGicI 

The Colorado Open Records Act requires a response within three business days (excludes holidays, closures and weekends). The three‐day timeline begins on the first business day following the receipt of the request.  Multiple requests in one email will be treated as one request for reimbursement purposes.  The district may also treat multiple requests concerning the same subject matter as one request.  The process is as follows: 
 
  * The CORA Officer will review your request and work with staff to determine: 
 
  * If the district is the custodian of the requested documents; 
  * How much staff time will be required to retrieve the documents (please note the below reimbursement policy for requests requiring more than one hour of staff time); and 
  * If an extension is necessary 
 
  * If applicable, within three business days of the receipt of the request, the CORA lead with notify you of the cost of your request and any extension needed to respond to your request. 
  * The CORA Officer will provide a final response to your request in accordance with the applicable CORA timeline after payment is received (as applicable). Please note: The Colorado Open Records Act only makes available public records that already exist. It does not require the creation of new records to respond to a request. It also does not require the district to manipulate or analyze existing information in a new way to respond to a request. CORA Reimbursement Policy ‐ 
The Colorado Open Records Act allows for the following reimbursement for reasonable costs associated with completing a request: 
 
  * Copying Expenses: We charge $0.25 for each hard‐copy page after the first 25 pages. 
  * Staff Time: For requests that require more than one hour of staff time, we charge $41.37 for each additional hour of staff time expended. 
  * There will be a retrieval charge for documents stored at an offsite facility, dependent on the number of boxes to be retrieved. 
  * Electronically stored files which are larger than 14MB will be transferred to a CD for a charge of $10 per CD. 
You can read more about the District’s CORA Policy 
You can monitor the progress of your request here. here.  You will receive an email when your request has been completed. 
To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the CORA Request Center

title: Glenn R. Miles FBI Files

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Glenn R. Miles FBI Files
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request any FBI records pertaining to Glenn R. Miles, who was killed in the line of duty as a Customs Agent for the U.S. Treasury Department in Arizona on February 21, 1986. This request includes, but is not limited to any FBI lab analysis of Agent Miles' handheld audio recorder, or references to its contents, as well as any 302s or field reports regarding Agent Miles' potential interactions with the alleged drug traffickers who were reportedly involved in his murder. Finally, this request includes any records sent or received by FBI to William Laverty, U.S. Customs Attache at the U.S. Embassy in Mexico City regarding the July 1986 arrest of five Mexican nationals in Hermosillo, Sonora, Mexico who were alleged to have been involved with the slaying.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

title: Recruitment and Hiring (Houston Police Department)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Recruitment and Hiring (Houston Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting records related to the department's efforts to recruit and hire new officers:
Records include digital and physical, released in their native forms (Excel, PDF, etc)

- ad purchases
- contracts with vendors for ad placement, recruitment and hiring 
- market research and data, if collected
- brand and department strategies created by ad agencies or internally
- data related to applications, KPIs of recruitment and hiring campaigns
- PowerPoint or equivalent presentations, including accompanying documents related to recruitment, hiring, and marketing strategies
- Budgets for recruitment and hiring internally, and the total money spent 
- Pay bonuses or financial incentives to retain officers
- Data by year on the number of officers, sworn and non-sworn

Search from 2021 to today's date.
Please provide in rolling production

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

Please be advised that the Austin Police Department’s Central Records Division receives over 2500 requests for information a month. These requests are processed in the order received, and we strive to respond to each request promptly, as required by law. 
Please know that, as a result of the large volume of requests received, the anticipated timeframe for responding to your request may take 10 business days if it is simply an offense report you're requesting.  If you are requesting body cam, dash cam, or other related records your request could take up to 30 days. 
You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records requested. PLEASE NOTE: The Texas Public Information Act does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Austin Public Records Center. 
Austin Police Department

title: Unrivaled

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Unrivaled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting records about the department's recruiting campaign, Unrivaled. VGCA (Very Good Creative Agency, LLC)

All documents, data collected pre- and post-campaign launch, PowerPoint or equivalent slides, assets including videos created in draft or final form, design mockups, and final designs. 

All in digital or physical format. Records should cover each part of the project and its deliverables, including findings, brand audits, SWOT analysis, other analysis findings in KPIs from the below categories

- Research and Discovery: market and consumer research, competitive analysis, strategic recommendations
- Strategy and Positioning: brand strategy development, market segmentation and targeting, positioning strategy, campaign planning and integrated strategies
- Concept and Create: creative concept development, message creation and copywriting, visual design and art direction
- Produce and activate: campaign production management, creative asset production, media production and placement, quality control and compliance, performance tracking and reporting
- Assess and optimize: data collection and analysis, audience targeting and personalization, campaign optimization, social media ad optimization, retargeting and remarking strategies

Invoices, contracts, payments, and agreements made by the ad agency or the department with vendors, influencers, trademark, and licensing of the LAPD name, anyone, and any company working externally to the department, purchases for ads, digital, and physical 

Please search 8/30/24 to today's date

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

title: Gerald Edward Connolly (March 30, 1950 – May 21, 2025)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Gerald Edward Connolly (March 30, 1950 – May 21, 2025)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into Congressman Gerald Edward Connolly (March 30, 1950 – May 21, 2025). His death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, you may find his Fox News obituary at the following link: https://www.foxnews.com/politics/virginia-democratic-rep-gerry-connolly-dead-75

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an assistant editor at Reason Magazine who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

Dear Danielle Danielle: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of Florida Department of Corrections. Your request has been received and is being processed. Your request was received in this office on 5/23/2025 12:44:25 AM and given the reference number R039780-052325 for tracking purposes. Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting Inmate Osias, Jerry #B12934 Records. I would like his disciplinary reports, including the affidavits with each violation, his visitation log and approved visitors, his contacts on the kiosk, his phone record logs, his documented tattoos along with photos if allowed, his mugshots taken throughout his time in doc, and his grievances, as well. Thank you!

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

Danielle

title: Human Experimentation

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Human Experimentation
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of all lab reports, surgical reports, and operative reports before, during, and after surgery regarding human experimentation performed  at Boston Children’s Hospital between 1960 and 1970. The lab reports should include: a title, abstract, introduction, method, results, discussion and conclusion. Also please include reports from the patient history program if any of the subjects participated in such programs. The information from such a program should include;   patient's medical history, symptoms, diagnoses, procedures, lab results, and demographic information.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Nicholas Rivellino JR

title: Open Records Request: Community Public Safety Grant

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Open Records Request: Community Public Safety Grant
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

According to a press release from Gov. Kemp's office on June 8, 2023, the Governor's office awarded more than $83.5 million in grants for 118 qualified projects as part of the Community Public Safety Grant program.

This included a grant of $832,960.70 awarded to Forsyth County described in additional documents provided by the Governor.

source: https://gov.georgia.gov/press-releases/2023-06-08/gov-kemp-announces-835m-community-public-safety-grant-awards

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of all documents, including but not limited to, applications, agreements, and reporting documents from the "Community Public Safety Grant" program for the grant of $832,960.70 awarded to Forsyth County as described in the Governor's press release and additional documents.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

e
